review: Works great as a media streaming box, with a few caveats:1. Netflix still has no voice search capability, so its rough to search for things without a keyboard. But you can attach a keyboard, so, not a massive negative.2. I like that you can sideload android apps via ADB, but its kinda lame that they don't show up in recent apps unless they are "Amazon approved" apps. There are ways around this (use Llama to launch a non-approved app when an approved app is launched) which make it not a massive negative either. I would also like to see a task manager or task switcher, but I guess it's asking a lot.3. No hardware decode support for some older codecs, but this is a small negative as well since there isn't a huge amount of content out there in VC-1. At some times, video playback on XBMC is a bit laggy, especially older formats (vc-1, wmv, or flv video) but mostly everything in h.264 plays back smooth as butter, so that's great.This has basically replaced my HTPC in my bedroom, and does pretty much everything I need it to do. Thanks Amazon!

review: The Fire TV is a good streaming box, but it has alot of shortcomings.-No Comcast Support for HBOGO or Showtime.  The Roku does.-The Fire TV is a data hog.  It will consume alot of data over the internet.  Beware if your internet provider has data caps.- The Fire Tv screen gives priority to the Amazon Store and Prime.  Netflix and other video services are buried and not easy to access without several clicks.-No USB or. DONA supprot for media files.  The Roku does.I like the FIRE TV, it still needs alot of work.
